verses.esv: 7 Have nothing to do with irreverent, silly myths. Rather train yourself for godliness;
verses.kjv: 7 But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.
verses.niv: 7 Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives' tales; rather, train yourself to be godly.

verses.esv:
28   A man without self-control
    is like a city broken into and left without walls.
verses.kjv: 28 He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
verses.niv: 28 Like a city whose walls are broken down is a man who lacks self-control.

verses.esv: 24 “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
verses.kjv: 24 No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.niv: 24 "No one can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money.

verses.esv: 31 “Do not turn to mediums or necromancers; do not seek them out, and so make yourselves unclean by them: I am the LORD your God.
verses.kjv: 31 Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.
verses.niv: 31 "'Do not turn to mediums or seek out spiritists, for you will be defiled by them. I am the LORD your God.

verses.esv: 8 Be sober-minded; be watchful. Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour.
verses.kjv: 8 Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:
verses.niv: 8 Be self-controlled and alert. Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.

verses.esv: 15 but in your hearts honor Christ the Lord as holy, always being prepared to make a defense to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you; yet do it with gentleness and respect,
verses.kjv: 15 But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:
verses.niv: 15 But in your hearts set apart Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect,

verses.esv: 7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
verses.kjv: 7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
verses.niv: 7 Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

verses.esv: 14 By the Holy Spirit who dwells within us, guard the good deposit entrusted to you.
verses.kjv: 14 That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.
verses.niv: 14 Guard the good deposit that was entrusted to you--guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us.

verses.esv: 22 Abstain from every form of evil.
verses.kjv: 22 Abstain from all appearance of evil.
verses.niv: 22 Avoid every kind of evil.

verses.esv: 27 and give no opportunity to the devil.
verses.kjv: 27 Neither give place to the devil.
verses.niv: 27 and do not give the devil a foothold.

verses.esv: 3:1 O foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you? It was before your eyes that Jesus Christ was publicly portrayed as crucified.
verses.kjv: 1 O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?
verses.niv: 1 You foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you? Before your very eyes Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed as crucified.

verses.esv: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, 23 gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law.
verses.kjv: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith, 23 Meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.
verses.niv: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, 23 gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law.

verses.esv: 33 Do not be deceived: “Bad company ruins good morals.”
verses.kjv: 33 Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
verses.niv: 33 Do not be misled: "Bad company corrupts good character."

verses.esv: 4 In their case the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelievers, to keep them from seeing the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.
verses.kjv: 4 In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.
verses.niv: 4 The god of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers, so that they cannot see the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.

verses.esv: 12 “All things are lawful for me,” but not all things are helpful. “All things are lawful for me,” but I will not be dominated by anything.
verses.kjv: 12 All things are lawful unto me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.
verses.niv: 12 "Everything is permissible for me"--but not everything is beneficial. "Everything is permissible for me"--but I will not be mastered by anything.

verses.esv: 12 Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, to make you obey its passions. 13 Do not present your members to sin as instruments for unrighteousness, but present yourselves to God as those who have been brought from death to life, and your members to God as instruments for righteousness.
verses.kjv: 12 Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof. 13 Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.
verses.niv: 12 Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its evil desires. 13 Do not offer the parts of your body to sin, as instruments of wickedness, but rather offer yourselves to God, as those who have been brought from death to life; and offer the parts of your body to him as instruments of righteousness.

verses.esv: 29 But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.
verses.kjv: 29 Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.
verses.niv: 29 Peter and the other apostles replied: "We must obey God rather than men!

verses.esv: 28 But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman with lustful intent has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
verses.kjv: 28 But I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.
verses.niv: 28 But I tell you that anyone who looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

verses.esv:
7   for he is like one who is inwardly calculating.
    “Eat and drink!” he says to you,
    but his heart is not with you.
verses.kjv: 7 For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.
verses.niv: 7 for he is the kind of man who is always thinking about the cost. "Eat and drink," he says to you, but his heart is not with you.

verses.esv: 28 Do not marvel at this, for an hour is coming when all who are in the tombs will hear his voice
verses.kjv: 28 Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,
verses.niv: 28 "Do not be amazed at this, for a time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice

verses.esv: 42 Therefore, stay awake, for you do not know on what day your Lord is coming.
verses.kjv: 42 Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.
verses.niv: 42 "Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.

verses.esv: 9 “When you come into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, you shall not learn to follow the abominable practices of those nations. 10 There shall not be found among you anyone who burns his son or his daughter as an offering, anyone who practices divination or tells fortunes or interprets omens, or a sorcerer 11 or a charmer or a medium or a necromancer or one who inquires of the dead, 12 for whoever does these things is an abomination to the LORD. And because of these abominations the LORD your God is driving them out before you. 13 You shall be blameless before the LORD your God,
verses.kjv: 9 When thou art come into the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not learn to do after the abominations of those nations. 10 There shall not be found among you any one that maketh his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, or that useth divination, or an observer of times, or an enchanter, or a witch, 11 Or a charmer, or a consulter with familiar spirits, or a wizard, or a necromancer. 12 For all that do these things are an abomination unto the LORD: and because of these abominations the LORD thy God doth drive them out from before thee. 13 Thou shalt be perfect with the LORD thy God.
verses.niv: 9 When you enter the land the LORD your God is giving you, do not learn to imitate the detestable ways of the nations there. 10 Let no one be found among you who sacrifices his son or daughter in the fire, who practices divination or sorcery, interprets omens, engages in witchcraft, 11 or casts spells, or who is a medium or spiritist or who consults the dead. 12 Anyone who does these things is detestable to the LORD, and because of these detestable practices the LORD your God will drive out those nations before you. 13 You must be blameless before the LORD your God.

verses.esv: 4 But the serpent said to the woman, “You will not surely die. 5 For God knows that when you eat of it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”
verses.kjv: 4 And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die: 5 For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
verses.niv: 4 "You will not surely die," the serpent said to the woman. 5 "For God knows that when you eat of it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil."

verses.esv: 10 and the devil who had deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur where the beast and the false prophet were, and they will be tormented day and night forever and ever.
verses.kjv: 10 And the devil that deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are, and shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.
verses.niv: 10 And the devil, who deceived them, was thrown into the lake of burning sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet had been thrown. They will be tormented day and night for ever and ever.

verses.kjv: 7 Even as Sodom and Gomorrha, and the cities about them in like manner, giving themselves over to fornication, and going after strange flesh, are set forth for an example, suffering the vengeance of eternal fire.
verses.niv: 1 Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ and a brother of James, To those who have been called, who are loved by God the Father and kept by Jesus Christ:
